required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Holmium Laser Uretherotomy in Combination With Intralesional Steroids in Bulbar Uretheral Stricture
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Holmium Laser Uretherotomy in Combination With Intralesional Steroids in the Treatment of Bulbar Uretheral Stricture

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose is to evaluate the outcome of visual internal uretherotomy with Holmium laser along with intralesional steroid injection.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigator evaluates the efficacy of Holmium laser in combination with intra lesional steroid injection in the treatment of bulbar urethral strictures

primary_outcome.measure: the maximum flow rate (Qmax) is >15 ml/s at 3 and 6 months after procedure
primary_outcome.description: The procedure will be accepted as successful when the maximum flow rate (Qmax) is >15 ml/s.

arm_group.description: Using Holmium laser uretherotomy only in the treatment of bulbar uretheral stricture
Using holmium laser uretherotomy with injection of 80 mg of triamcinolone (diluted with normal saline to 10 ml) in the treatment of bulbar uretheral stricture

intervention.description: Holmium YAG Laser with pulse energy from 1-2 Joule, frequency from 10-15 Hertz and total power from 3.0 to 30.0 Watt were set up, respectively, based on the extent of the lesions. Scar tissue was incised at the position of 12-o'clock under the guidance of guidewire or ureteric catheter till fresh mucosa appeared.

After laser urethrotomy, 80 mg of triamcinolone (diluted with normal saline to 10 ml) will be injected by using an injection needle (5 F size and 23 G needle size) at 10 sites, 1 ml each, along the site of urethrotomy and circumferentially.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of obstructive symptoms,
2. Short segment strictures (stricture length <2 cm) as evident on radiological studies, i.e. retrograde urethrography and micturating cystourethrography.
3. Peak flow rate on uroflowmetry less than 15 ml/s
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Complete obliteration of lumen of urethra on urethroscopy,
2. Balanitis Xerotica Obliterans,
3. Age less than 18 years,
4. Multiple strictures,
5. Active urinary tract infection,
6. Recurrent Strictures.
7. Prior internal uretherotomy
8. Prior urethroplasty
9. Pan-anterior urethral strictures
10. Posterior stenosis
11. Those who lost to follow up
